meanings.sent1: The boy's hands were dirty after playing in the mud.
meanings.sent2: She washed her dirty clothes in the laundry machine.
meanings.sent3: The dog's dirty paws left muddy prints all over the floor.
meanings.sent4: The dirty water in the pond reflected the cloudy sky above.
meanings.sent5: The dirty dishes in the sink attracted flies and ants.

meanings.sent1: The dirty water from the factory polluted the river.
meanings.sent2: He refused to drink the dirty water from the rusty tap.
meanings.sent3: The dirty air in the city made her sneeze constantly.
meanings.sent4: The dirty thoughts in his mind clouded his judgment.
meanings.sent5: The dirty oil spill harmed the marine life in the ocean.

meanings.sent1: The politician was involved in a dirty scandal.
meanings.sent2: She didn't trust his dirty tactics in the business deal.
meanings.sent3: The dirty lies he told eventually caught up with him.
meanings.sent4: The dirty tricks he played on his friends backfired.
meanings.sent5: The dirty schemes of the con artist were finally exposed.

meanings.sent1: Please don't dirty the clean floor with your muddy shoes.
meanings.sent2: He accidentally dirtied his shirt while working in the garden.
meanings.sent3: She tried not to dirty her hands while painting the walls.
meanings.sent4: The rain dirtied the freshly washed car parked outside.
meanings.sent5: He didn't want to dirty the crystal vase with fingerprints.
